---
title: "R Data Types"
format: html
---
Checking data types
```{r}
# create vector
vec_1 <- c(2, 5, 9, 10, 8, 12, 1, 0)
class(vec_1)
typeof(vec_1)

# access and store elements
vec_1_e3 <- vec_1[3]
vec_1_e3

vec_1_e1 <- vec_1[1]
vec_1_e1

vec_1_e5to7 <- vec_1[5:7]
vec_1_e5to7

# reassign as character
vec_1_char <- as.character(vec_1)
vec_1_char

# create second vector 
vec_2 <- c(town = "Santa Barbara", location = "Rincon", swell = "south")
vec_2
class(vec_2)
```

```{r}
# create a data frame
df_1 <- data.frame(region = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),
                   species = c("otter", "great white", "sea lion", "gray whale"),
                   count = c(12, 2, 36, 6))
df_1
class(df_1)
class(df_1$species)

# max count value
max_count <- (df_1$count[order(df_1$count)])[1]
max_count

```
